channel.title: Homes on Guangyao (Stannis) Zhou
channel.description: Recent content in Homes on Guangyao (Stannis) Zhou

item.description: About I am currently a Postdoctoral Associate in the Division of Applied Math, Brown University, where I completed my Ph.D. dissertation in August, 2018. I received my bachelor degrees from Peking University. Here’s my CV. I am currently focused on designing probabilistic generative models for computer vision, in collaboration with Stuart Geman and Matthew Harrison. The idea is to embed discrete compositional models into continuous and differentiable architectures so as to harness modern computational tools.

item.title: Teaching
item.description: At Brown University: Teaching Assistant, APMA 1650 Statistical Inference, Fall 2013 Teaching Assistant, APMA 0650 Essential Statistics, Spring 2014 Substitute Lecturer, APMA 2610 Recent Applications of Probability and Statistics, Spring 2015 Mentor, APMA Grad-Undergrad Mentoring Program, Fall 2016&Spring 2017
